chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Y: Set
X: Set
icomp: (nat -> nat) -> nat -> X -> list Y
ilen: X -> nat
Hilen: forall (lnk : nat -> nat) (n : nat) (x : X), length (icomp lnk n x) = ilen x
state_Y: Type
state_X: Type
step_X: X -> nat * state_X -> nat * state_X -> Prop
step_Y: Y -> nat * state_Y -> nat * state_Y -> Prop
step_X_tot: forall (I : X) (st1 : nat * state_X), exists st2 : nat * state_X, I /X/ st1 -1> st2
step_Y_fun: forall (I : Y) (st st1 st2 : nat * state_Y), I /Y/ st -1> st1 -> I /Y/ st -1> st2 -> st1 = st2
simul: state_X -> state_Y -> Prop
Hicomp: instruction_compiler_sound
P: (nat * list X)%type
iQ: nat
iP: nat
cP: list X
err: nat
P_eq: P = (iP, cP)

Goal:
{lnk : nat -> nat & {Q : nat * list Y | fst Q = iQ /\ lnk iP = iQ /\ (forall i : nat, out_code i P -> lnk i = code_end Q) /\ (forall (i1 : nat) (v1 : state_X) (w1 : state_Y) (i2 : nat) (v2 : state_X), v1 ⋈ w1 /\ P /X/ (i1, v1) ~~> (i2, v2) -> exists w2 : state_Y, v2 ⋈ w2 /\ Q /Y/ (lnk i1, w1) ~~> (lnk i2, w2)) /\ (forall (i1 : nat) (v1 : state_X) (w1 : state_Y) (j2 : nat) (w2 : state_Y), v1 ⋈ w1 /\ Q /Y/ (lnk i1, w1) ~~> (j2, w2) -> exists (i2 : nat) (v2 : state_X), v2 ⋈ w2 /\ P /X/ (i1, v1) ~~> (i2, v2) /\ j2 = lnk i2)}}

Premises:

Record Q : Set := Qmake { Qnum : BinNums.Z; Qden : BinNums.positive } Arguments QArith_base.Qmake _%Z_scope _%positive_scope
Inductive True : Prop := I : True
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
Notation lnk := gen_linker
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
gen_compiler_sound : forall (i1 : nat) (v1 : state_X) (i2 : nat) (v2 : state_X) (w1 : state_Y), v1 ⋈ w1 /\ (iP, cP) /X/ (i1, v1) ~~> (i2, v2) -> exists w2 : state_Y, v2 ⋈ w2 /\ (iQ, cQ) /Y/ (lnk i1, w1) ~~> (lnk i2, w2)
compiler_complete' : forall (linker : nat -> nat) (P : nat * list X) (Q : nat * list Y), (forall (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc P -> (linker i, icomp linker i I) <sc Q /\ linker (1 + i) = ilen I + linker i) ->...-> exists (i2 : nat) (v2 : state_X) (w2 : state_Y), v2 ⋈ w2 /\ P /X/ (i1, v1) ~~> (i2, v2) /\ Q /Y/ (linker i2, w2) ~~> st
instruction_compiler_sound = forall (lnk : nat -> nat) (I : X) (i1 : nat) (v1 : state_X) (i2 : nat) (v2 : state_X) (w1 : state_Y), I /X/ (i1, v1) -1> (i2, v2) -> lnk (1 + i1) = length (icomp lnk i1 I) + lnk i1 -> v1 ⋈ w1 -> exists w2 : state_Y, (lnk i1, icomp lnk i1 I) /Y/ (lnk i1, w1) -+> (lnk i2, w2) /\ v2 ⋈ w2 : Prop
compiler_sound : forall (linker : nat -> nat) (P : nat * list X) (Q : nat * list Y), (forall (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc P -> (linker i, icomp linker i I) <sc Q /\ linker (1 + i) = ilen I + linker i) -> forall (i1 : nat) (v1 : state_X) (i2 : nat) (v2 : state_X) (w1 : state_Y), v1 ⋈ w1 /\ P /X/ (i1, v1) -> > (i2, v2) -> exists w2 : state_Y, v2 ⋈ w2 /\ Q /Y/ (linker i1, w1) -> > (linker i2, w2)
compiler_complete : forall (linker : nat -> nat) (P : nat * list X) (Q : nat * list Y), (forall (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc P -> (linker i, icomp linker i I) <sc Q /\ linker (1 + i) = ilen I + linker i) -> forall (i1 : nat) (v1 : state_X) (w1 : state_Y), v1 ⋈ w1 -> Q /Y/ (linker i1, w1) ↓ -> P /X/ (i1, v1) ↓
compiler_complete_step : forall (linker : nat -> nat) (P : nat * list X) (Q : nat * list Y), (forall (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc P -> (linker i, icomp linker i I) <sc Q /\ linker (1 + i) = ilen I + linker i) -> forall (p : nat) (st1 : nat * state_X) (w1 w3 : nat * state_Y), snd st1 ⋈ snd w1 -> linker (fst st1) = fst w1 -> in_code (fst st1) P -> out_code (fst w3) Q -> Q /Y/ w1 -[ p ] -> w3 ->...-> w3 /\ q < p
